title: How many of us on the boards actually LIKE the high damage in the game right now?
body:
I'm genuinely curious, because all I see here are players who dislike the current state of the game (including myself), so I want to see what the actual consensus is.  Because if Riot are pushing for faster-paced, more damaging games, perhaps it would be good to get some numbers on this. 

Apologies if this poll has been done before.

replies.body: I think late game champions are doing a little too much damage early
{{champion:516}} ............. {{sticker:sg-lulu}}
Ornn does too much damage consistently for a tank, not just early. Same with Galio, though Galio isn't technically supposed to be a tank.

Items are too cheap. To reference another comment I made the other day, crit and lethality items are the go to carry items, and they're too cheap. Adc has always started to hurt with just 50% crit, but with so much early gold they are building it too fast. If an adc gets the double kill bot with first blood and first tower, they are already miles ahead, and with how damage like crit scales it's just too fast. And lethality needs to be more costly too. An MF with just Duskblade won't just dominate bot lane, she'll curb stomp it. Dusk and Youmuus alone will get her Qs to nearly 700 damage. That's basically an IE crit on a squishy. 

Items for carrying are too cheap and tank items are not able to keep up. The way to fix it is to make them more expensive so that marksmen, a class specifically designed to end the game, aren't ending the game at 20 minutes. 

More expensive items also means that you won't get stomped if you come back with just a long sword and they have BF sword.

TLDR: More expensive items means less damage items, less damage items means less damage, less damage means less kills, less kills means less objectives, less objectives means longer games.

Holy hell cant agree more. When did league become a game of deleting?
The game isn’t about strategy anymore; it’s only about who makes the first mistake. And it all snowballs from there.
games are way too snowbally, you often lsot before the 5 minute mark with no way to come back, and that's just not fun for anyone

You must be very bad at the game if you  loose a game at 5 min mark.

1st people cry about games being too long. Now people cry about games being too short.

if enemy adc gets a kill in first 5 mins, the game is likely over if they have any skill. period. because that's literaly meta atm

early enemy lead turns to massive snow ball turns to game over you lose
Especially those "late game adcs" with "hard laning phases" {{champion:67}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:29}}

I just played Tristana for the first time a little while ago. Every guide I read talked about her bad laning phase and playing safe. 

Then I played her and won nearly every lane I played her into.  I couldn't believe how easy her lane was. 

Maybe I just had crap opponents.

Tristana has a "bad" lane phase because all her cooldowns are about 20 seconds early, and she auto pushes because you max E. If you can deal with those two limitations, her lane phase is fairly good for someone who likes to play aggressive and she snowballs hard.
or you had a very good support.  Or the enemy support was horrible.
You must not actually be playing if you think it is otherwise right now.
What do you expect when you cried about games being too long?

I haven't been having much fun with League lately. It's either stomp or be stomped and that just isn't fun for me. 

So I play other games because my enjoyment is just not here. If League manages to grab my interest again, sure i'll come back. However until than, i'll have fun else where.

I dislike it. I dislike this lethality favortism, understand it is "preseason" but still so many champs feel bad. Tank items feel like they do nothing. 

Felt like the only reasons I played this weekend is because friends and them having a spare pc for me to use and the skin shards from the event. A couple games were okay mostly with them. Yet most were not that great even when winning.

We need more lethality buffs {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} {{item:3147}} 
/sarcasm
Careful, ad assassins will defend this busted item until the day they die if u dare speak ill. Even tho it’s true that it’s a bullshit item and gives way too much for what it’s worth

My problem is when I win I don't feel like I earned it and when I loose I feel like I didn't even get a chance to enjoy the lane phase let alone the game itself... it's not fun to win and it's near impossible to catch back up.

No. Way too much damage. Not only that, but this game has been stuck in the high mobility dash/flash type champions for too long. The ability to run/dash/flash is too much. People are sidestepping skillshots so easy without even having boots. It's just ridiculous.
This, the game is too far gone imo, it seems my league days are over :(

I'm taking a break until damage is lowered. So I guess I'll be gone for a while.



*I'll probably be dead before then.
*If I am online, it's because my friends wanted me to.

My last game was on 11/8/17. I don't see that changing.

Answered this poll with my feet lol. On the bright side having a fucking blast playing HotS.
I'm with you. I want to play LoL, but it's crazy. HoTS at least is designed to be short, fast games. LoL feels like it's a total accident and there's no control.

You actually feel the difference. 
More than half leagues roster is complete shit in the current meta because this game was never meant to be this wannabe CoD moba. 
Hots on the other hand feels completely different and even a stomp i never felt like i could do NOTHING unless my team consists of bonobos then its even worse than in lol.

Dumped LoL for the preseason cluster fuck and have gone back to my steam library. It's all "super fun" for some people (anyone that plays adc seems to love it shocker), but it is boring as shit to me as someone who plays mostly top/support. Maybe they should make the game fun for EVERYONE, and not just people who can like...abuse Ezreal or something.

I agree with the snowbally comments. 

I don't necessarily feel like games are too short.  I don't think I've noticed them being horribly shorter than before. 

However, I have had a lot of games that I feel like are lost by the 15 minute mark, even if it takes the other team until 30 to 35 minutes to actually fully end the game.

I don't want to see damage across the board gutted like what people call for. I just want champions/classes that shouldn't have access to burst not fucking have access to burst. Giving assassins counter play was a good move, now hold everyone else up to the same standard and things will be fine. And no, giving supports more broken active item effects for shielding/healing isn't how to do that, pull power out of those and give it to their kits so they can contribute to the team still, but make it so they exist beyond being a ward/redemption slave chained to their God and master, the ADC. Also, buff towers (actually buff them, not nerf them in disguise like you already did Rito) that will solve game length issues alone.

The damage was no where near as relatively high, as the TTKs were 5-10 seconds in season two, and here, I've seen them as little as .6 seconds on bruisers and juggernauts.  Sure they were being focused, but before they could survive that focus for several seconds.  Now they just fuckin' pop.

> [{quoted}](name=PB4UAME,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=etfuy5OB,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-11-27T06:07:12.943+0000)
>
> The damage was no where near as relatively high, as the TTKs were 5-10 seconds in season two, and here, I've seen them as little as .6 seconds on bruisers and juggernauts.  Sure they were being focused, but before they could survive that focus for several seconds.  Now they just fuckin' pop.

Yeah damage is way too high and sustained damage classes have way too much burst damage. One game this season we killed a full tank malphite in a second. I was like “wtf how did he die so fast?”
I don't mind since the champions I play always have some form of 'bypassing damage' capabilities, e.g. Lissandra and her R

Don't forget that tanks can do all that "high damage" while building nothing but tank items, yet live much much longer.

It's also like that botlane.
Live much longer? Put a fed {{champion:67}}{{champion:18}} {{champion:29}}  vs any one of those tanks and watch them melt like butter.

Which tanks are you talking about? Ornn?

You sure as shit aren't talking about the class, so stop generalizing....
{{champion:111}} {{champion:20}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:154}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:72}} 

You see those icons? That is the absolutely under performing pile of shit that builds tank items, and they aren't doing a damn thing right now but getting kited, cc'd forever, and popped almost instantly with the crazy damage being put out atm.

It's funny how any adc can pick up an IE, and fuck anything with a heartbeat in under 3 seconds, but all we hear about are the 1-2 that op for a month, before passing the torch. Then we get a couple of recently reworked/buffed tanks that are doing well, and the whole class is op.
If you get kited as Zac , Malph or Naut that is your own problem lol

The problem is not about damage, but its biased favoring AD and ADC . Meanwhile ignoring Juggernauts,Tanks,Mages. IF every role felt satisfying to play then there would be no reason to argue about balance.

Ever since 7.22, I still have yet to have a game last longer than 28 minutes.  

I have written this in many other threads, but it needs to be reiterated:

This is obviously the direction that Riot wants the game to go.  Faster paced, more damage, greater "omg" factor for the LC$BigPlay$.  I don't like it, it really doesn't feel like the same game I fell in love with six-and-a-half years ago, actually I hate the direction it's gone in... with that being said it's just better for everyone that we accept it because it's not going back to the way it was.  

There is practically no laning phase any more, there is almost no time to react because of how fast everything does damage.  Had a teamfight today that lasted less than 6 seconds...

"Too fast-paced" isn't the exact right way to express what I feel about the current game state. It's more like it's just too _snowbally_. First Blood seems to consistently happen around the 6 minute mark in my games, and it feels like if you die in lane once you can't walk back without dying again. I've actually had a good percentage of Rift games get to the 40-minute mark, but not without one team or the other suffering a serial "feeder".

I stopped playing hypercarries because unless my jungler camps my lane, I'm likely not going to get the chance to scale anyway because my teammates want to surrender at 15 and at that point, they've already stopped giving a fuck because the game is THAT much of a snowball.
I dont, that fking champs like Jhin are pure retardness

I don't like it. It sucks when someone can just stand still and auto with champs like {{champion:21}} {{champion:29}} {{champion:96}} but still out burst you regardless of your orb walkin skill dodging mechanics.

Umm I chose the
"Damage is in a perfect spot and games are too short" option

We have two gamemodes for ultra high damage. Those are URF and Bloodmoon.

I feel like I'm stuck playing them constantly...

> [{quoted}](name=NekoniClaws,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=etfuy5OB,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2017-11-27T02:45:27.145+0000)
>
> URF .
> 
> I feel like I'm stuck playing them constantly...

I wish

I love the current feel of league of legends. Damage feels high where it makes sense to and my average game time has not really changed. Wish riot would fix fighters though or make enchanters a little less brainlessly strong one of the two.

Making a poll on a board which is obviously biased , wonder what the result will be lul. 

Even if 200 people here said games are still too long , it would literally mean nothing. Not everyone who plays league wastes their time on boards/reddit or some shit.
I just think that Zoe's sleep is bullshit.

Hi all, thanks for your input and votes.  I'm not sure if Riot will notice or care, but if at least one Rioter noticed this and saw that approximately 76.5% of players (at time of writing) believe that the game is too fast and damaging.  It's a small sample size to be sure, but it may well be similar to the results of a much larger sample and Riot should be aware of this.
Oh shit this poll tricked me. I read "how many of us like this" and hit "yes" but I meant to vote that I like this >_<
